## conjugate() function

If given a [ComplexArray](./dsp.complexarray.md)<!-- -->, computes the complex conjugate, concatenates it in mirrored order to input (excluding bin 0) and returns it as new (complex) array.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function conjugate(src: NumericArray, isImg?: boolean): NumericArray;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  src | <code>NumericArray</code> |  |
|  isImg | <code>boolean</code> |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

`NumericArray`

## Remarks

The length of the input buffer(s) is assumed to be a power of 2.

If given a [NumericArray](./api.numericarray.md)<!-- -->, the `isImg` arg chooses from one of the following operations: If `true` (default), returns new array with \*negated\* values concatenated in reverse order. If `false`<!-- -->, returns new array with \*original\* values concatenated in reverse order.

## Example 1


```ts
conjugate([0, 3, 2, 1], true)
// Float64Array [ 0, 3, 2, 1, 0, -1, -2, -3 ]

conjugate([0, 3, 2, 1], false)
// Float64Array [ 0, 3, 2, 1, 0, 1, 2, 3 ]

conjugate([[0, 1, 0, 1], [0, -0.5, 0, -0.25]])
[
  Float64Array [ 0, 1, 0, 1, 0, 1, 0, 1 ],
  Float64Array [ 0, -0.5, 0, -0.25, 0, 0.25, 0, 0.5 ]
]

```

## Example 2


```ts
// generate single-period sine (window size = 16)
ifft(conjugate([0, -8, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0]))[0]
// [
//   0, 0.383, 0.707, 0.924,
//   1, 0.924, 0.707, 0.383,
//   0, -0.384, -0.707, -0.924,
//   -1, -0.924, -0.707, -0.383
// ]

```
